verses.verse: Now the Spirit speaks explicitly that in latter times some will depart from the faith turning their attention to seducing spirits and teachings of demons,
telling lies with hypocrisy, having their conscience seared,
forbidding to marry, [and demanding] abstinence from foods, which God has created, to be partaken with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
For every creature of God is good and nothing is to be refused, if it is received with thanksgiving,
for it is made holy by the word of God and prayer.
If you remind the brethren of these things you will be a good servant of Jesus Christ, nourished in the words of faith and good teaching to which you have carefully followed.
Shun crude myths and old wives' tales, instead exercise yourself for godliness.
For bodily exercise profits little, but godliness is beneficial for everything having a promise of this present life and the one to come.
This is a trustworthy saying, deserving full acceptance.
It is for this that we labor and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe.
Let no one despise your young age, instead be an example to the believers in word, behavior, love, attitude, faith, and purity.
Until I come apply yourself to reading, exhortation, and to teaching.
Do not neglect the gift in you, which was given to you by prophecy with the laying on of hands by the elders.
Carefully think about these things; give yourself wholly to them, so your progress may be obvious to all.
Watch yourself and your teaching; continue in them, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those hearing you.
